articles.title: Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Drive for Recovery from Flood That Hit Rason City
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Drive for Recovery from Flood that Hit Rason City
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA), gave field guidance to the drive for recovery from the flood that hit Rason City.
					 He said that he came to the city as he could hardly fall asleep, thinking of the citizens left without shelter due to flood damage and he could feel relieved only after looking round the scenes of recovery drive. Watching dwelling houses for people springing up like mushrooms after rain thanks to the devoted struggle of service personnel to thoroughly implement the order of the Party through thick and thin, I feel freed from all cares and worries, he added.
					
					 Being told that the living of the people in the afflicted area was brought to normal as the Party took important measures one after another for the recovery from the flooding and sent a lot of foodstuff, daily necessities, etc. to them and they were deeply touched by the repeated loving care shown by the Party for them, he noted that it is the bounden duty of the WPK to take warm and responsible care of the destiny of the people whom President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il regarded as Heaven in their lifetime and officials should not be complacent with the work for the people, he stressed.
					
					 He said it is a great success that service personnel and people have wound up, in the main, projects for repairing the inundated houses for thousands of families and temporary rehabilitation of power, telecommunications and railway networks in the city since the start of the recovery drive by their concerted efforts.
					
					 Noting that it is his determination to build dwelling houses more wonderful, modern and better than the old ones for the people in the afflicted area, he gave an instruction to dynamically push ahead with the construction of dwelling houses as a main thrust of the recovery drive in the city.
					
					 He ardently called on all builders to wind up the drive at the highest level without fail before the 70th founding anniversary of the WPK by fully displaying the spirit of devotedly implementing the decisions of the Party, the spirit of flattening even a mountain and emptying even a sea, and thus make the rousing cheers for socialism, the WPK and single-minded unity heard in the sky in October.
					
					 Saying that the people of the DPRK are the best in the world as they believe in and invariably follow the WPK only, he ardently called on the officials to dedicate themselves to the work for the happy future of those people, always remembering their trust and expectation and take warmer care of them, true to the noble intention of the great leaders.
					
					 He was accompanied by KPA Vice-Marshal Hwang Pyong So, director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, Ri Il Hwan, department director of the WPK Central Committee, and Jo Yong Won, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with a congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the 67th birthday of the DPRK led by Hong In Hum, chairman of the Central Audit Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.

articles.title: Congratulations to Egyptian PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Egyptian PM 
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the Cabinet of the DPRK, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Sherif Ismail upon his appointment as prime minister of Egypt. 
					 The message wished him successes in his responsible work for the country's stability and socio-economic development, expressing belief that the excellent relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from British Senator
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from British Senator 
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from Neil Forbes Davidson, senator from the British Labor Party, on a visit to the DPRK. 
					 The senator conveyed the gift to an official concerned on Friday.

articles.title: S. Korea's Moves to Railroad "Bill on Human Rights in North" through NA Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korea's Moves to Railroad "Bill on Human Rights in North" through NA Denounced 
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Lawyers Association of Korea Friday issued a statement denouncing ruling and opposition politicians and conservative group of south Korea for their moves to railroad the "bill on human rights in the north" through the "National Assembly." 
					 These moves are a politically-motivated provocation totally denying the dignity and social system of the DPRK and a blatant challenge to the desire and aspiration of all Koreans for national concord and reunification, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The "bill on human rights in the north" is an evil one swimming against the national aspiration and the trend of the times and height of illegality as it is disregarding elementary requirement and principle for enacting a law. 
					
					 The south Korean "National Assembly's" unreasonable handling of the "issue of human rights in the north" is a wanton violation of the sovereignty and internal affairs of the DPRK. It is a serious violation of the principle of respect for other's sovereignty recognized by international law. 
					
					 The above-said moves of the south Korean philistines are nothing but desperate efforts of those taken aback by the might of the DPRK where the national dignity and might are demonstrated at the highest level and its people fully enjoy happiness under the wise leadership of the peerlessly great man. 
					
					 The south Korean politicians would be well advised to mind their own business in south Korea, the worst tundra of human rights in the world, before talking nonsense. 
					
					 Hangers-on in Youido including politicians of the ruling and opposition parties of south Korea should not go busy squandering money collected from people as taxes, instead of fulfilling their commitments, but institute a proper law guaranteeing the south Koreans suffering from dire destitution the right to existence even a bit. 
					
					 All the service personnel and people of the DPRK will never allow any provocative moves of the hostile forces to cook up the anti-DPRK confrontational law but decisively foil them without mercy.

articles.title: Senator from British Labor Party Here
articles.content:
Senator from British Labor Party Here
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Neil Forbes Davidson, senator from the British Labor Party, and his party arrived here on Friday.

articles.title: EAFF Delegation Here
articles.content:
EAFF Delegation Here
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the East Asian Football Federation (EAFF) led by Chairman Zhang Jian arrived here on Friday to take part in the 46th meeting of the Executive Committee of EAFF.
					 The Football Association of the DPRK hosted a reception in honor of the delegation on the day.

articles.title: Delegation of Ministry of People's Security back Home
articles.content:
Delegation of Ministry of People's Security back Home
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of People's Security led by Councilor Ri Song Chol returned home on Friday after taking part in the 2nd World Firefighting and Rescue Forum held in Moscow.

articles.title: Co-Chairman of Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation Council Leaves
articles.content:
Co-Chairman of Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation Council Leaves
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Johnny Hon, co-chairman of the Council of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation, left here on Friday.

articles.title: Co-Chairman of Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation Council Visits Various Places
articles.content:
Co-Chairman of Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation Council Visits Various Places
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Johnny Hon, co-chairman of the Council of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation, visited the Munsu Water Park on Friday.
					 He went round the indoor wading pool and other places of the water park, being briefed on the fact that the Munsu Water Park was excellently built as the comprehensive leisure complex on the picturesque bank of the Taedong River.
					
					 He visited the Mirim Riding Club and the Meari Shooting Gallery on the same day.

articles.title: Itinerant Art Squad of Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station Gives Performance
articles.content:
Itinerant Art Squad of Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station Gives Performance
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The itinerant art squad of the Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station gave a performance at the Youth Park Open-Air Theatre Friday.
					 Among the audience were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the youth league, officials of the youth league and youths and students.
					
					 In such numbers as trio poem "Love and Feat" the performers impressively represented the profound trust and loving care shown by Marshal Kim Jong Un while projecting the feats performed by youths in Mt. Paektu and glorifying their position on the highest level.
					
					 Its repertoire was pervaded with dynamism of youth and ardent enthusiasm.
					
					 The performance was acclaimed by the audience. 
					
					 The performance will go on.

articles.title: Achievements Made in Health Service of DPRK
articles.content:
Achievements Made in Health Service of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The 16th National Exhibition of Scientific and Technological Achievements in Public Health took place at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House here from September 4 to 11.
					 The exhibition was aimed to give wide publicity to the sci-tech achievements made in health service and activate the interchange of intellectual products.
					
					 According to Ryu Yong Chol, department director of the DPRK Ministry of Public Health, more than 1700 pieces of achievements were presented to the exhibition.
					
					 They included "Korean Bibliography on Natural Treatment Resources" and other books and multimedia.

articles.title: 8th Pyongyang Musical Instruments Exhibition Held
articles.content:
8th Pyongyang Musical Instruments Exhibition Held
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The 8th Pyongyang Musical Instruments Exhibition was held from Sept. 15 to 18. 
					 Displayed in the venue of the exhibition were more than 1 400 musical instruments of over 50 kinds produced and manufactured by musical instruments production units, organs for art education, factories and enterprises and individual musical instruments makers, parts of instruments, articles of consumption and jigs and tools for manufacturing instruments.
					
					 There were also domestic and foreign technical information related to the production of musical instruments, and instruments displayed by overseas compatriots and foreigners. 
					
					 There were experience-sharing meeting, information for science and technology and concert with national instruments and other events during the exhibition.
					
					 A closing ceremony was held at the Pyongyang International House of Culture Friday. 
					
					 Present there were Kim Tok Hun, vice-premier, Pak Chun Nam, minister of Culture, officials, researchers, teachers and students of relevant fields and units that presented instruments, overseas Koreans and foreigners who presented musical instruments to the exhibition.

articles.title: Traditional Peasant Dance of Korea
articles.content:
Traditional Peasant Dance of Korea
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, agricultural workers in Pyongyang had a peasant dancing contest at the foot of scenic Moran Hill.
					 Peasant dance, a Korean folk dance, is strong in national flavor and optimism.
					
					 By nature, this popular dance was only for men and its movements are virile with main stress put on turning round decorative tassels.
					
					 The peasant dance is now developing to conform to the modern aesthetic taste under the literary art policy of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 This dance can be seen in national events as well as in year-end payment places of co-op farms.

articles.title: Pyongyang Corn Processing Factory
articles.content:
Pyongyang Corn Processing Factory
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The newly-built Pyongyang Corn Processing Factory began its operation on the threshold of the 70th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Located in Rangnang District, Pyongyang City, the factory covers an area of 12 800 square meters and all its production processes are put on an unmanned, germ-free and dust-free basis.
					
					 It produces noodle, crushed corn, sweet jelly, cake, popcorn, oil and steamed bread.
					
					 The factory also has a bathhouse and other modernly-equipped service facilities and its compound is forested with thousands of fruit trees, shrubs and other species of trees.
					
					 Installed on the roofs of its buildings are solar panels and solar water heaters.
					
					 An integral production system is established at the factory and all its products are made with locally available raw materials. Its employees can receive tele-education at the sci-tech knowledge room.
					
					 When visiting the factory in August, supreme leader Kim Jong Un praised it as an icon foodstuff factory.

articles.title: Attaching Importance to Youth Is Ever-Strategic Line of WPK
articles.content:
Attaching Importance to Youth Is Ever-Strategic Line of WPK
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Friday dedicates an article to the first anniversary of the publication of Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Young People, Be Vanguard Fighters Unfailingly Faithful to the Party's Revolutionary Cause of Songun." 
					 The work, published on September 18, Juche 103 (2014), deals with the feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who created the unique idea of attaching importance to youth and successfully implemented it and the path of heroic struggle covered by the young Koreans under their guidance.
					
					 It indicates the tasks and ways for bringing about an epochal turn in the youth work including the issue of training the young people into reliable heirs to the Songun revolution as required by the developing revolution. 
					
					 Attaching importance to the youth is the strategic line the great leaders consistently preserved during the whole period of the leadership over the revolution, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The politics of the Workers' Party of Korea on attaching importance to the youth has been carried forward onto a higher stage in the present era led by Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The ranks of youth in the DPRK is developing into an ideologically pure entity guided by the idea and will of the WPK and young Korean people are growing to be reliable heirs to the revolution and genuine core elements of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism. This is unthinkable without the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The DPRK will always shine all over the world as a power of youth as long as there are the large contingent of youth best in the world brought up by the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and the wise guidance of the WPK.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on Right to Satellite Launch
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on Right to Satellite Launch 
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- It was reported recently that satellites of Songun Korea would be launched at the time and place decided by the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 Satellites represent the indomitable soul of the DPRK and a manifestation of the boundless strength to achieve prosperity and a symbol of sovereignty. 
					
					 That is why the people who love truth and justice envy the proud appearance of the DPRK making a leap forward towards a space power. 
					
					 Contrary to this, the evil-minded U.S. and south Korean conservative forces are busy slandering the DPRK with sheer sophism and unreasonable assertions. 
					
					 They branded the answers of the directors of the National Aerospace Development Administration and the Atomic Energy Institute of the DPRK as "red light to south-north relations," "opposition to international community" and "provocation." 
					
					 It is the unpardonable provocation against the DPRK to take issue with the space development for peaceful purposes, the legitimate right of a sovereign state recognized by international law. 
					
					 The space development is the trend of the world at present and many countries produce and launch diverse satellites. The space is coming close to the living aspects indispensable to the people. 
					
					 This goes to prove that gone are days when a few countries could develop space in the past but there has arrived a new era in which many countries are developing the space. 
					
					 The satellite launch of the DPRK is also a peaceful undertaking according to the scientific and technical development program of the state for building an economic power and improving the people's living standard. 
					
					 The DPRK has a comprehensive state program for developing space envisaging steady launch of diverse satellites necessary for the development of national science and technology and economy and national defence. 
					
					 Satellite launch showing the overall national power of Songun Korea and the development of latest science and technology is part of the efforts to implement this magnificent program. 
					
					 The DPRK's study of the space science, manufacturing of working satellites and their launches and control are a legitimate independent right of a sovereign state and they are in full line with the outer space treaty which defines the peaceful use of space as generally accepted rights of members of the United Nations. 
					
					 A drive for breaking through the cutting edge in the space development is an important affair for the scientists, technicians and workers of the DPRK with national dignity and self-respect. 
					
					 Nothing is more foolish than misinterpreting the satellite development of the DPRK and working hard to block it in this bright world. 
					
					 It is our sovereign right to put into space the satellite built with our indigenous efforts and technology from A to Z. 
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea and people of the DPRK are fully determined to legitimately exercise this right no matter what others may say. 
					
					 Increased efforts of the hostile forces to scuttle the space program of the DPRK would only help intensify its counter-action.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Stage North-targeted River-crossing Drill
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Stage North-targeted River-crossing Drill 
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- A brigade under the 11th Motorized Infantry Division of the south Korean army staged a river-crossing drill aiming at preemptive attack on the DPRK on the bank of the North Han River in Hwachon County of Kangwon Province of south Korea on September 16, according to the south Korean Yonhap News. 
					 The drill was staged with main emphasis on examining the river-crossing capability of newly introduced armored cars and maximizing the maneuverability of motorized forces.
					
					 Their ceaseless saber-rattling for preemptive attack on the DPRK is laying a grave obstacle in the way of implementing the agreement reached at the north-south high-level urgent contact.

articles.title: War Maneuvers in S. Korea
articles.content:
War Maneuvers in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The Third Marine Division of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and the Second Marine Division of south Korea have staged war drills to invade the DPRK in the forefront area of Kyonggi Province on Sept. 7, according to the south Korean internet paper Newsis.
					 The warmongers who had been keen on guerrilla training to get accustomed to mountain terrain of the Korean Peninsula at the training ground in Kimpho till Sept. 11 kicked off such drills as combat in urban area and individual firepower shooting from Sept. 13.
					
					 Timed to coincide with this, artillery forces under the Marine Corps were hell-bent on a drill for position occupation, situation drill and shelling drill in Phaju.
					
					 Such play with fire is dangerous war frenzy hurting the atmosphere of defusing tension on the Korean Peninsula and improving the north-south relations.

articles.title: Person Convicted of Spy Case during Military Dictatorial Rule Acquitted in S. Korea
articles.content:
Person Convicted of Spy Case during Military Dictatorial Rule Acquitted in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The Seoul High Court gave Ri Ju Gwang a verdict of not guilty on Sept. 16, according to Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea. Ri was convicted of "a spy case" by the Chun Doo Hwan military dictatorial forces.
					 Early in the 1980s the Security Command arrested Ri, a Korean student in Japan who came to south Korea to study, on the suspicion that "he attempted to overthrow the state" after getting in touch with the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and receiving an instruction from the north. The fascist dictatorial forces sentenced him to 15 years in jail and to the same term of suspension of qualifications in 1983.
					
					 The truth about the conspiratorial case has been probed several decades since then and a verdict of not guilty was given to Ri.

articles.title: S. Korean Juveniles Driven into Crimes and Suicides
articles.content:
S. Korean Juveniles Driven into Crimes and Suicides
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Herald Economy on Sept. 12 said recently a 15 year old secondary schoolboy intentionally exploded a gas cylinder in a classroom and photographed the whole course of the crime before posting it on a website. 
					 The unreasonable education policy of the authorities and regular violence at schools cause to juveniles unbearable pain, driving them into crimes and suicides, it charged.
					
					 100-200 schoolchildren commit suicides in south Korea every year.
					
					 The number of juvenile suicides reached 1 000 for seven years up to last year from 2008, according to even data announced by the south Korean authorities. 118 juveniles committed suicides last year and 61 as of August this year.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced by Austrian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced by Austrian Organization
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and Our People" was posted on its homepage by the Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK on the occasion of the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The work, published on April 20, Juche 101 (2012), deals with the revolutionary exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il all their lives.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks for firmly defending the idea and exploits of the President and Kim Jong Il and adding shine to them forever.

articles.title: DPRK's Birth Anniversary Observed Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Birth Anniversary Observed Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 They included meetings, seminars, photo and book exhibitions and film shows in Finland, Spain and Angola from September 8 to 11.
					
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos documenting the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display there were their works, and books and photos introducing the invincible might of Songun Korea.
					
					 Films shown included Korean film "My Country Has Emerged Victorious by Dint of Single-minded Unity."
					
					 The chairman of the Paektu Association of Finland in his speech said that the President was the father of socialist Korea as he led the long and arduous anti-Japanese armed struggle, rescuing the Korean people from the miserable destiny of colonial slaves and putting them forward as masters of the country.
					
					 The chairman and the international secretary of the Finnish Communists' League praised the President as an ever-victorious iron-willed brilliant commander and the world's elder statesman as he defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation and made great contribution to the cause of global independence.
					
					 The chairman of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain and other figures highly praised the nation-building exploit performed by the President and expressed belief that the Korean people would surely achieve a final victory.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the events in Finland.

articles.title: DPRK's Founding Anniversary Marked at DPRK Missions Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Founding Anniversary Marked at DPRK Missions Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- There took place receptions, friendship meetings, photo and book exhibitions and film shows at the DPRK missions in Cuba, Vietnam, Indonesia, Thailand, Kuwait, Germany, Italy, Sweden, Romania, Guinea, Uganda, Senegal, Ethiopia, Brazil and Peru from September 3 to 9 on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos documenting the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display there were their works, and books and photos introducing history of victory and glory of Songun Korea.
					
					 Korean films "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation" and "My Country Has Emerged Victorious by Dint of Single-minded Unity" were shown at the film shows.
					
					 Present there on invitation were personages of various circles and members of the organizations for the study of the Juche Idea and organizations for friendship and Solidarity with the Korean people of relevant countries.
					
					 Present there were officials of the DPRK missions in the relevant countries.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Nation-building Exploit Introduced by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Nation-building Exploit Introduced by Foreign Newspapers
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried articles on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 The Nigerian newspaper Nigerian Observer on September 3 in an article said:
					
					 The history of the development of the DPRK shining as a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in defence would have been unthinkable without the nation-building exploit performed by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The President built the DPRK into an independent country firmly adhering to the socialist idea and principles.
					
					 He firmly consolidated the socio-political foothold of the DPRK with his benevolent politics.
					
					 In the DPRK names of the country, the army and monumental structures are called by the word the people. Such reality would be unthinkable without the politics of the President who built the DPRK into the socialist country centred on the popular masses.
					
					 He consolidated the military foundation of the DPRK with his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 The Egyptian paper Al-Misaiya on September 6 reported that the foundation of the DPRK, once suffered an eclipse on the world map in the past, helped it display its dignity and might as an invincible power no one dares provoke.
					
					 The paper said that the DPRK has regarded the Juche idea as its guidelines and accelerated the building of a thriving nation undeterred by any storms.
					
					 The DR Congolese newspaper L'Avenir on September 7 noted that all the people are enjoying an independent and creative life and learning to their hearts' content in the DPRK, adding that such advantageous education system is a brilliant fruition of the energetic leadership of the President and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: British Organizations Call for Opposing Broadcasting Plan against DPRK
articles.content:
British Organizations Call for Opposing Broadcasting Plan against DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association UK released a joint appeal on September 9 as regards the BBC's decision to start short-wave radio broadcasting against the DPRK.
					 The appeal said:
					
					 It is a well-known fact that the BBC acts as a spokesman of the British information organ.
					
					 Recently the BBC decided to make short-wave radio broadcasting against the DPRK.
					
					 This means that the British imperialists join in the psychological warfare of the U.S. imperialists and south Korean authorities and shows that the nature of the British ruling class has not changed as it is a wanton infringement upon the sovereignty of the DPRK.
					
					 The BBC is notorious for taking the lead in toppling the socialist systems in the former Soviet Union and eastern European countries in the period of the Cold War.
					
					 It is shameful that the BBC spends money for the plan reminiscent of that in the period of the Cold War at a time when the people are suffering from the joblessness and poverty by the government's austerity policy and the broadcasting corporation itself is reducing its own appropriation.
					
					 The organizations called on all the British political parties and organizations to come out in the movement against the said plan.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige restauracion de ciudad de Rason
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige restauracion de ciudad de Rason
						
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno la restauracion de la ciudad de Rason danada por inundaciones.
					El Mariscal dijo que no podia tomar sueno al recordar a los damnificados por inundaciones y vino asi para calmar su impaciencia recorriendo en persona los lugares de restauracion y continuo que sin embargo, se sintio libre de  tales preocupaciones al ver levantarse las viviendas de la poblacion por los abnegados esfuerzos de los oficiales y soldados del ejercito popular por materializar a cabalidad la orden del Partido.
					
					Al recibir el parte de que los moradores se quedaron muy conmovidos por las continuas solicitudes del partido que tomo las medidas importantes para la restauracion de la ciudad de Rason y envio muchos comestibles y articulos de primera necesidad para darles la estabilidad de vida, el Mariscal subrayo que es el deber merecido del Partido del Trabajo de Corea encargarse totalmente del destino de nuestro pueblo y cuidar cordialmente la vida de ellos a quienes los grandes Lideres consideraron como cielo durante todas sus vidas, por lo tanto nosotros no debemos satisfacerse en la labor por el pueblo.
					
					Es un gran exito el hecho de que los militares y civiles unidos desde el inicio de la rehabilitacion hasta la fecha, terminaron la reparacion de miles de viviendas inundadas y la restauracion provisional de las redes de electricidad, comunicacion y ferrovia de la ciudad de Rason, subrayo.
					
					Es mi decision ofrecer a los habitantes damnificados las viviendas mas vistosas, modernas y magnificas que las anteriores, enfatizo y ordeno desplegar mas dinamicamente por construir las viviendas, objetos fundamentales de la restauracion de la ciudad.
					
					El Mariscal exhorto fervorosamente a todos los constructores concluir sin falta en el nivel maximo la restauracion de la ciudad de Rason antes del 70o aniversario de la fundacion del PTC al manifestar plenamente el espiritu de materializacion a ultranza de la decision del partido para que se repercuta mas alto en el cielo de octubre las vivas del socialismo, del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y de la unidad monolitica 
					
					Nuestro pueblo es el mejor en el mundo que vive solo confiando y siguiendo sin alteracion a nuestro Partido, dijo y continuo que sin olvidar la confianza y la esperanza del pueblo tan excelente, debemos sacrificarnos por el futuro feliz del pueblo y enaltecer mas bien al pueblo como enaltecemos a los grandes lideres. 
					
					Le acompanaron el vicemariscal del EPC Hwang Pyong So, jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, el jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Il Hwan y el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: AJDC denuncia maniobras de banda surcoreana encaminadas a inventar "ley de DDHH de Norte"
articles.content:
AJDC denuncia maniobras de banda surcoreana encaminadas a inventar "ley de DDHH de Norte"
						
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El portavoz de la Asociacion de Juristas Democraticos de Corea hizo publica hoy una declaracion denunciando a los politiqueros en el poder y opositores y los compinches conservadores que tratan de inventar la "ley de DDHH del Norte (de Corea)".
					Tal movimiento constituye una provocacion politica que niega totalmente la dignidad y el regimen de la RPDC y un desafio total al deseo de todos los connacionales aspirantes a la reconciliacion y la reunificacion de la nacion, senala la nota y prosigue:
					
					La "ley de DDHH del Norte" es la maligna que contraviene a la aspiracion nacional y la corriente de la epoca, y el climax de la ilegalidad que desprecia hasta las elementales demandas y principios de la institucion juridica.
					
					La atrevida discusion sobre el "problema de DDHH del Norte" en la "Asamblea Nacional" surcoreana deviene una violacion de la soberania y los asuntos interiores de la RPDC y de los principios de respeto a la soberania estipulados por la ley internacional.
					
					Las maquinaciones de los politicastros surcoreanos encaminadas a fabricar dicha "ley" son el esfuerzo desesperado de los atemorizados ante el aspecto de la RPDC donde han llegado al nivel maximo la dignidad y el poderio de la nacion y el pueblo goza de todas las felicidades bajo la sabia orientacion del gran hombre sin igual.
					
					A los politiqueros surcoreanos les convendria corregir primero los asuntos interiores de su territorio, convertido en la tundra de DDHH, antes de lanzar tales boberias.
					
					Los parasitos de Youido incluyendo los partidos en el poder y opositor deben instituir una ley correcta para asegurar el derecho a existencia de los habitantes surcoreanos en vez de entregarse a malgastar los impuestos de los surcoreanos.
					
					El ejercito y pueblo coreanos no perdonaran jamas cualesquier provocaciones de las fuerzas hostiles para inventar la "ley de DDHH del Norte", de caracter conflictivo anti-RPDC, y las frustraran tajante y despiadadamente.

articles.title: Efectuada exhibicion nacional de logros cientifico-tecnicos de rama de salud
articles.content:
Efectuada exhibicion nacional de logros cientifico-tecnicos de rama de salud
						
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar del dia 4 al 11 en la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones la XVI exhibicion nacional de logros cientifico-tecnicos de la rama de salud publica.
					La exhibicion se organizo para dar a conocer ampliamente los exitos cientifico-tecnicos logrados en el dominio de salud publica y activar mas el intercambio de productos intelectuales.
					
					Ryu Yong Chol, director de departamento del Ministerio de Salud Publica de la RPDC, dijo que se presentaron en la ocasion mas de 1 700 exitos logrados por los funcionarios, profesores e investigadores de ese sector, y prosiguio:
					
					Acapararon la atencion de los participantes las piezas, hechas con recursos y tecnicas nacionales, que surtiran efectos sustanciales en la asistencia medica. 
					
					El Instituto Superior de Medicina de la Universidad Kim Il Sung exhibio los equipos de operacion elaborados con sus propias fuerzas que antes se apoyaban en importaciones.
					
					Se presentaron la "Bibliografia Coreana sobre Recursos de Tratamiento Natural" y otros libros y programas de multimedia.
					
					Durante el periodo de la exhibicion tambien se realizo la presentacion tecnica, ocasion en la cual los participantes intercambiaron los exitos y experiencias obtenidos en la investigacion de las ciencias y tecnicas medicinales.

articles.title: Efectuada exhibicion de instrumentos musicales
articles.content:
Efectuada exhibicion de instrumentos musicales
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar del dia 15 al 18 la VIII exhibicion de instrumentos musicales de Pyongyang.
					Alli se presentaron mas de 1 400 instrumentos musicales, los accesorios, articulos de consumo, dispositivos y  herramientas para la elaboracion de instrumentos de mas de 50 generos inventados por los organos de educacion artistica, fabricas, empresas e inventores individuales.
					
					Tambien se resaltaban a la vista los datos tecnicos nacionales y extranjeros referentes a la fabricacion de instrumento musical y los instrumentos de musica expuestos por los compatriotas en ultramar y los extranjeros.
					
					Durante la feria, hubo la presentacion de experiencia para modernizar y nacionalizar los aparatos, equipos y materiales para la elaboracion de instrumentos musicales y aumentar su produccion, la informacion de ciencias y tecnicas y el recital de instrumentos de musica nacionales, etc.
					
					La ceremonia de clausura se efectuo hoy en la Casa Internacional de Cultura de Pyongyang con la participacion del vicepremier Kim Tok Hun, el ministro de Cultura, Pak Chun Nam, los funcionarios e investigadores de los sectores relacionados y unidades exponentes, investigadores, profesores y estudiantes, compatriotas y ultramar y extranjeros que presentaron los instrumentos musicales en la exhibicion.
